playwright.description: Browser automation via Playwright exposed through MCP. Allows navigation, DOM interactions, screenshots, form submission, and structured extraction.
useCases: Automated testing of web UIs and flows.
Extracting structured content when no API is available.
Filling forms or simulating user interactions deterministically.
notGoodFor: Automating native desktop applications with GUI controls (requires desktop automation tools).
High-speed scraping of large datasets (browser automation is slower than HTTP-based extraction).
Sites requiring CAPTCHA or strong bot detection handling without proxies.
limitations: Browser context reinitialization may reset session/state.
Running multiple concurrent browser contexts increases memory and CPU usage.
Detected by some anti-bot mechanisms without additional configuration.
playwright.examplePrompt: Navigate to https://news.ycombinator.com and return the titles and URLs of the top 10 stories.

zai-mcp-server.description: Vision and video analysis MCP server powered by GLM-4.5V (106B parameters) for multimodal understanding. Analyzes images and videos with state-of-the-art performance across 42 vision-language benchmarks.
useCases: Analyzing images for scene understanding and object recognition.
Processing videos for event recognition and segmentation.
Parsing charts, diagrams, and long documents visually.
GUI task processing and spatial recognition.
Multi-image analysis for complex visual reasoning.
notGoodFor: Pure text-only tasks (GLM-4.5V focused on multimodal scenarios).
Direct image pasting in most clients (must reference local file paths).
Audio processing (no native audio input support).
Fine-grained perception tasks like precise counting or identifying specific individuals.
Free tier usage (requires GLM Coding Plan Pro or higher at $15+/month).
limitations: Requires paid subscription: GLM Coding Plan Pro ($15/month) or Max ($45/month).
Images must be placed in local directories and referenced by path (direct pasting unsupported).
Node.js 18+ required (22+ recommended).
Closed-source implementation (not publicly auditable).
May output raw HTML without markdown wrapping.
Text-only Q&A capabilities need improvement compared to vision tasks.
zai-mcp-server.examplePrompt: Analyze the screenshot at /path/to/screenshot.png and describe the UI layout, identifying any accessibility issues or design inconsistencies.

sequential-thinking.description: A reasoning scaffolding MCP server that structures task execution into deliberate multi-step sequences.
useCases: Breaking ambiguous tasks into smaller sequential steps.
Planning multi-phase workflows before executing.
Enforcing slower, more deliberate reasoning to reduce mistakes.
notGoodFor: Tasks requiring immediate execution rather than planning.
Low-latency or real-time operations.
Automations where each step is already well-defined.
limitations: Adds overhead and latency to responses.
Does not execute tasks itself â€” requires pairing with another MCP server.
Structured plans may still require validation or human review.
sequential-thinking.examplePrompt: Plan the steps required to migrate a legacy database to PostgreSQL before executing any commands.

chrome-devtools.description: Direct Chrome DevTools Protocol access for browser automation, performance analysis, and debugging with native Chrome integration.
useCases: Performance profiling and analysis of web applications.
Native Chrome DevTools automation for debugging workflows.
Browser automation when Chrome-specific features are required.
Network request inspection and console message analysis.
notGoodFor: Cross-browser testing (use Playwright for multi-browser support).
Production web scraping without proper anti-detection measures.
File system operations or terminal command execution (requires system access tools).
Applications requiring extensive form automation without debugging focus.
limitations: Limited to Chrome/Chromium browsers only.
Several active bugs including screenshot resets in mobile emulation.
No built-in cookie management or user agent modification.
Browser instance cleanup issues - no clean shutdown mechanism.
Protocol connection errors under certain conditions.
chrome-devtools.examplePrompt: Analyze the performance metrics of https://example.com and identify the top 3 performance bottlenecks affecting page load time.

serena.description: Advanced coding agent toolkit providing semantic retrieval and editing capabilities through symbol-level operations. Acts like an IDE with refactoring, code navigation, and multi-language support.
useCases: Large codebase analysis and understanding
Safe refactoring across multiple files
Finding references and symbol relationships
Working with polyglot/monorepo projects
IDE-like code navigation and editing
notGoodFor: Simple text editing tasks
Projects without proper language server support
Very small codebases where overhead isn't justified
Environments with strict security requirements
limitations: Requires Python 3.11+ and proper language server setup
Can be resource-intensive on large projects
May experience timeouts with very large codebases
Some tools execute code without permission prompts
serena.examplePrompt: Analyze this codebase to understand the architecture, then refactor the UserService class to follow the repository pattern, updating all references across the project.

context7.description: Real-time documentation search and retrieval MCP server providing up-to-date code documentation for 50,000+ libraries. Injects current documentation context directly into AI development workflows.
useCases: Finding the latest documentation for any library or framework during development
Getting context about unfamiliar APIs before writing code
Verifying function signatures and parameters in real-time
Cross-referencing documentation across multiple libraries
Staying updated with breaking changes and version-specific documentation
Building prompts with accurate, up-to-date library information
notGoodFor: Low-latency operations requiring immediate responses (documentation lookup adds overhead)
Offline development scenarios without internet connectivity
Very stable legacy codebases where documentation rarely changes
Tasks not involving external library reference or documentation
limitations: Requires internet connectivity to fetch documentation
Rate limiting applies without API key - higher limits with free account from context7.com/dashboard
API key required for production usage or higher rate limits
Documentation freshness depends on source repositories and indexing
Some niche libraries may not be available in the database
context7.examplePrompt: Show me the latest documentation for React hooks and fetch the current API reference for the OpenAI v1 API to help write a new integration.

desktop-commander.description: Terminal and filesystem operations MCP server providing command-line execution, file editing, in-memory code execution, and process management with audit logging. Focuses on system-level operations via terminal, NOT GUI desktop automation.
useCases: Executing terminal commands with interactive process control
Performing filesystem operations and file editing with surgical precision
Running code in memory (Python, Node.js, R) without saving files
Instant data analysis of CSV/JSON files
Searching files and content with ripgrep-based recursive search
Managing long-running processes and development servers
System administration and maintenance tasks
Code analysis and refactoring operations
notGoodFor: GUI automation or desktop application control (no visual interface capabilities)
Browser automation or web interactions (use playwright or chrome-devtools)
Cross-platform desktop application testing (requires GUI automation tools)
Visual element recognition and interaction (use computer vision tools)
Production environments requiring strict command whitelisting without audit trails
limitations: Requires Node.js v18+ for installation (Docker option available)
Recent security vulnerabilities discovered (directory traversal, command bypass)
Some potentially dangerous commands are blocked by default for safety
Full system access requires careful security consideration and monitoring
Docker installation provides isolation but with reduced capabilities
Performance may vary across platforms (Windows users report more connection issues)
desktop-commander.examplePrompt: Analyze the performance of the current git repository, identify large files, and run a code quality check on the main source files.

video-processing.description: Comprehensive video processing MCP server providing analysis, conversion, format detection, and frame extraction capabilities. Built on FFmpeg with security-focused input validation and size limits.
useCases: Analyzing video content and extracting metadata information.
Converting between video formats (MP4, MOV, M4V, AVI, WMV, WebM).
Extracting specific frames or creating frame sequences from videos.
Validating video files and checking for corruption or format issues.
Generating video thumbnails and previews for content management.
Processing video files for web optimization and compression.
notGoodFor: Real-time video streaming or live video processing (requires specialized streaming tools).
Large-scale video batch processing without proper resource management (may exceed memory/time limits).
Video editing operations requiring timeline-based editing or complex effects (use dedicated video editing software).
Audio-only processing (use audio-specific tools for better performance).
limitations: Maximum file size limited to 8MB by default for security and performance reasons.
Processing time depends on file size and system resources (large files may take several minutes).
Requires FFmpeg installation on the host system for video processing operations.
Some advanced video formats or codecs may not be supported depending on FFmpeg build configuration.
Concurrent processing limited by system memory and CPU resources.
Network-based video processing depends on connection stability and download speed.
video-processing.examplePrompt: Analyze the video file /path/to/video.mp4, extract its metadata, and convert it to WebM format with optimized settings for web playback.

mermaid-mcp-server.description: MCP server for converting Mermaid diagram syntax to PNG images or SVG files using headless Chrome rendering. Supports themes, custom backgrounds, and multiple output formats for professional diagram generation.
useCases: Generating flowcharts and sequence diagrams from text descriptions.
Creating architecture diagrams and system design visualizations.
Documenting processes and workflows with professional diagrams.
Converting complex relationships into visual diagram representations.
Enhancing technical documentation with automated diagram generation.
Creating Git graphs, Gantt charts, and organizational charts.
notGoodFor: Real-time interactive diagram editing (requires dedicated diagramming tools).
High-volume batch processing without resource management (browser overhead per request).
Complex vector graphics manipulation beyond standard Mermaid capabilities.
Production environments requiring strict security without sandboxing.
Applications needing sub-second response times for diagram generation.
limitations: High memory usage (~100-200MB per request) due to headless Chrome requirements.
Performance overhead from browser startup and rendering (~1-3 seconds per diagram).
Security vulnerabilities present (path traversal, loose browser security settings).
Single-threaded processing limits concurrent request handling.
Requires Node.js 18+ and sufficient system resources for Chrome operations.
Early-stage development with potential stability issues and limited community support.
mermaid-mcp-server.examplePrompt: Create a flowchart showing the user authentication process with decision points, using the dark theme and transparent background.

brave-search.description: Comprehensive web search with AI summarization providing access to web, images, videos, news, and local business search through Brave's search API. Offers structured results with metadata and real-time information discovery.
useCases: Researching current topics and finding up-to-date information across the web.
Searching for local businesses, restaurants, and services with ratings and details.
Finding relevant news articles and recent developments on specific topics.
Discovering tutorial videos and multimedia content for learning.
Getting AI-powered summaries of search results for quick insights.
Conducting comprehensive research across multiple content types in a single query.
notGoodFor: Browser automation or interactive web page manipulation (use playwright or chrome-devtools).
Accessing content behind paywalls or authentication-protected sites.
Real-time data streaming or continuous monitoring of web content changes.
High-volume automated scraping without proper rate limit consideration.
Navigating specific websites or filling out forms (requires browser automation tools).
limitations: Requires Brave Search API key - free tier offers 2,000 queries/month with rate limits.
Conservative rate limiting (1 request/second, 15,000/month) may impact high-throughput workflows.
Some users report connection issues and MCP ERROR 32000 in certain configurations.
No test coverage in the codebase - potential quality and reliability concerns.
Search results limited to Brave's index and ranking algorithms.
API key must be kept secure and properly configured as environment variable.
brave-search.examplePrompt: Search for recent developments in quantum computing and provide a summary of the key breakthroughs from the past month.

tavily.description: Comprehensive web access MCP server providing real-time search, intelligent extraction, structured mapping, and systematic crawling capabilities. Optimized for AI agents with LLM-friendly results and citation support.
useCases: Researching current topics and extracting structured data from web pages.
Systematically exploring websites and creating comprehensive site maps.
Crawling web content for data collection and analysis projects.
Academic research requiring citation-backed search results.
Market intelligence gathering with structured data extraction.
Competitive analysis through comprehensive web data collection.
notGoodFor: Real-time web page interaction or form automation (requires browser automation tools).
High-volume automated scraping without rate limit consideration.
Accessing content behind authentication or paywalls without proper credentials.
Local file system operations or system-level automation (requires filesystem tools).
Offline operations or scenarios without internet connectivity.
limitations: Requires Tavily API key - free tier offers 1,000 credits/month with rate limits.
Rate limiting applies based on subscription tier and usage patterns.
Search results limited to Tavily's web index and crawling capabilities.
API key security required - must be properly stored as environment variable.
Dependent on internet connectivity and Tavily API service availability.
tavily.examplePrompt: Search for recent developments in renewable energy technology, extract key data points from the top results, and provide citations for each finding.

z-ai-web-search-prime.description: Cloud-based web search MCP server providing real-time information retrieval including web search, news, and weather data. HTTP/SSE remote service requiring no local installation, exclusively for GLM Coding Plan subscribers.
useCases: Retrieving latest web information and current events during development workflows.
Accessing real-time news updates and trending topics.
Getting weather information for location-based features.
Researching technology developments and best practices.
Supplementing coding tasks with up-to-date documentation searches.
Market research and competitive analysis with current web data.
notGoodFor: Browser automation or interactive web page manipulation (use playwright or chrome-devtools).
Accessing content behind paywalls or authentication-protected sites.
Free tier usage (requires GLM Coding Plan Pro at $15/month minimum).
Heavy search usage exceeding quota limits (1,000 searches/month on Pro, 4,000 on Max).
Privacy-sensitive scenarios requiring local-only processing.
Offline development without internet connectivity.
limitations: Requires paid subscription: GLM Coding Plan Pro ($15/month for 1,000 searches) or Max ($45/month for 4,000 searches).
API key authentication required - obtain from Z.AI Console.
Search quotas enforced per billing cycle (resets every 5 hours for prompt limits).
Account must have sufficient balance/credits for API usage.
Cloud-dependent service - requires stable internet connectivity.
Limited community transparency (closed-source, no public issue tracker).
Citation accuracy issues common to AI search engines (60%+ failure rate industry-wide).
Not available on Lite tier ($3/month) - Pro tier minimum required.
z-ai-web-search-prime.examplePrompt: Search for the latest AI technology developments and find best practices for Python asynchronous programming, then summarize the key findings.
